summary: We testified that 80 percent of Southwest border banks limited or did not offer services to customers that are considered high risk for money laundering. Banks may choose to limit services because they must conduct extra account monitoring of these customers to comply with Bank Secrecy Act/anti-money laundering oversight. Money transmitters serving Haiti, Liberia, Nepal, and Somalia also reported losing bank accounts for this reason...
title: Bank Secrecy Act: Further Actions Needed to Address Domestic and International Derisking Concerns
